data.text: @dkcarr @wehadkeecreek @TracyBethHoeg Yes, and right before CA had their huge spike all those mandates were still in place. One could also argue that FL has a higher rate of seniors over 65 per 100k as well and likely contributed to a higher rate of death.

@Leslie_Prince24 @wehadkeecreek @TracyBethHoeg FL had many of the same mandates as CA. They just removed them much sooner. Right before that huge spike in FL cumulative deaths per capita that put them ahead of CA by 15 deaths per 100k. (i.e. thousands more dead than had they stayed the same rate as CA)

@TracyBethHoeg @sjpbythebay @DrYo6102 @CAgovernor So it looks like FL took a big jump in cumulative COVID deaths just a month or two after DeSantis outlawed all local mandates. Additionally, that graph makes it look like they are nearly the same, but that difference accounts for about 5k fewer deaths in CA.

@TracyBethHoeg Do you believe that Florida has been tracking and publishing all data (cases, hospitalizations, deaths) as completely and transparently as California has? I don't believe they have but perhaps you have greater access to the data than I do.

@TracyBethHoeg If *I* were a doctor participating in a 90-minute airing of grievances I'd probably prioritize making sure someone who blames doctors for every COVID-19 death never participates in something like this again.
@TracyBethHoeg I'm not going to watch 1.5 hours of it, but I'm curious if anyone at the panel spent any of that time correcting the many lies of Robert Malone and Peter McCullough who participated.
@GrantAcosta5 @TracyBethHoeg She makes up data all the time and/or cherry picks it. Incredibly unethical.
@TracyBethHoeg I will also request you lose your board certification by ABPMR. You endanger and indeed hurt and kill children by your actions as a physician.
@TracyBethHoeg I will do all I can as a pediatrician to get your medical license revoked for unethical and unprofessional behavior.
